body: Ah. This is actually a bug with the code that the underlying syntax highlighter, Pygments, uses to highlight Stata code, and not specifically an issue with this kernel. @mcaceresb originally wrote that; I've been meaning to update it, but haven't gotten around to it yet, and hadn't been aware of any actual errors like this. It's pretty easy to fix this. Should be able to within a few days. Note for me and @mcaceresb: To reproduce, create a file `test.do` with the contents ``` `"`r(levels)'"' ``` then run ``` pygmentize -O full -f html -l stata -o test.html test.do ``` The red box here ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15164633/45442874-375aa280-b691-11e8-8894-b94048aee664.png) in HTML has class `err`: ```html r(levels) ``` In the Stata pygments lexer [source](https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main/src/7941677dc77d4f2bf0bbd6140ade85a9454b8b80/pygments/lexers/stata.py), the flow goes like this: - See `` `" ``, enter `vars-strings` and then add `String` scope and enter into `string_mquote`. - Inside `string_mquote`, it then matches `` ` ``, which adds scope `Name.Variable` and enters into `var_validlocal`. - Inside `var_validlocal`, the only rule is `\w{0,31}`. But locals can include many more characters, such as `(`. Since there is no fallback option, this produces an error in Pygments.

@mcaceresb am I correct in noting that there has been [no activity](https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main/commits/branch/default) in the Pygments repository for 18 months?

For something like this or Codemirror syntax highlighting, I may add highlighting files to this repository, and then as part of starting the kernel, check if the files at
```py
from pkg_resources import resource_filename
resource_filename('pygments', 'lexers/stata.py')
```

are current, and if not, replace them.

[This says](https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main) there was movement in the past month.

At any rate, yes, I ought to patch that...

But I have no idea how bitbucket arrives at that date... All of the branches date back at least to March 2017:
https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main/branches/

> * Inside `var_validlocal`, the only rule is `\w{0,31}`. But locals can include many more characters, such as `(`. Since there is no fallback option, this produces an error in Pygments.

Interesting. Per our prior discussions almost anything can be in a local, though. I reckon I ought to just copy the rules you implemented in your repo, no?

It does seem pygments doesn't get updated anymore, or at least not very often.

`language-stata` isn't perfectly translatable to Pygments. There are parts that don't make sense to add, and the structure of the syntax file is somewhat different. Do you want me to make a PR to your `highlight-sas-stata` repo?

Otherwise I'd just work on a pygments file for highlighting in this repo.

Pygments hasn't had a release since January 2017: https://pypi.org/project/Pygments/
Whatever is easier for you; if you don't make a PR I can just copy it and integrate it to the hl-sas-stata repo, which I really ought to update at this point. Will make time this weekend.

Any thoughts on how to handle nested globals? Since I'm highlighting everything for locals this is fine, but globals need not have the `{}` as delimiters and everything after 32 characters seems to get ignored.
Can you have nested globals if you don't use `${}`?
But even `{}` fails if the global is too long...
(Global names are limited to 32 characters in Stata, no matter how they are named; local names to 31.)

> But even {} fails if the global is too long...

Sure, but I don't necessarily think it's important for this syntax highlighter to be exact in this way. If we color a 35-character word as a global, when they run it in Stata they'll discover it's too long

@jeremyfreese The issue is that Stata evaluates things in `${}` and `` `' `` other than global and local variable _names_. For instance, it evaluates locals inside `${}`, and it evaluates all sorts of things inside `` `' ``. We had a field day figuring out corner cases [here](https://github.com/kylebarron/language-stata/issues/90), which started with trying to figure out comment parsing rules. 

For instance:
```stata
local i 1
disp "i = `i++Locals here are evaluated. `++i', `++i', and `i++' are evaluated.'"

local i = 1
disp `i"/*`++i'*/"Does this print 1, 2, 3? /*"`++i'"*/'
```

For nested globals, name length only applies to the final evaluation, so this is valid:
```stata
global HelloThisIsAVeryLengthyGlobalYes 23
local RandomLocalAlsoVeryLongName ThisIsAVeryLengthyGlobal
disp "${Hello`RandomLocalAlsoVeryLongName'Yes}"
```

> Sure, but I don't necessarily think it's important for this syntax highlighter to be exact in this way. If we color a 35-character word as a global, when they run it in Stata they'll discover it's too long

Sure, agreed.

Ah, I get it.  BTW, this sort of nested global is legal in Stata without using {}:

. global a = "b"
. global b = "fred"
. display "$$a"
fred

Not saying it's advisable or that I've ever seen it in the wild, but it's legal.  I find nesting locals in locals, on the other hand, extremely handy and do it a LOT.

Btw this is fixed in the Stata lexer [here](https://github.com/mcaceresb/highlight-sas-stata). You can replace the old pygments lexer on your system with `pygments/pygments/lexers/stata.py` on that repo. 

I'll submit a PR but, as noted, that might take a while to make it upstream. @kylebarron Not sure if you can replace the lexer during the install?

@jeremyfreese (and @mcaceresb)

If you have Git installed, can you try this out:
```
pip install git+https://github.com/kylebarron/stata_kernel@dev-pygments --upgrade
```

Then when you do `jupyter notebook` and start a Stata kernel, it _should_ replace the Pygments code with our updated code. So for me, your code looks like this in an HTML file:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15164633/45527631-a841ad80-b7aa-11e8-8e02-be9c55510b31.png)
